review_text: This Airbnb was an awesome find for us! We usually stay in Airbnb's so are very selective. This quaint older home is so beautifully updated and had ALL the comforts needed. Courtney had even decorated it for the holidays which made it feel all the more homey! We come to CDA annually as a getaway reprieve from all the holiday rush, so we look for quiet and comfort and we sure found it! Its located very close to anything you could want to do in the resort area of CDA. We just parked our car (right out front so very convenient!) and when ready to explore we were able to walk the couple of blocks to coffee shops, restaurants, parks and the resort for our cruise. The couple of times I needed to communicate Courtney was very responsive and quick to get back to me. Her Nitty Gritty book with descriptions of amenities along with suggestions and maps for the area was very helpful. We thought it was a fantastic place and are already planning our next CDA visit with Courtney and this Airbnb!

review_text: I cannot share enough positive sentiments about this cute Airbnb! My initial attraction to this airbnb was that Courntey posted the wifi internet speed, which was a huge factor since I work from home. I was able to enjoy moments away from my desk and explore the downtown that was walking distance. Within 2 blocks we were near delicious restaurants and cute coffee shops, with nightlife options too. The amount of amenities Courtney offers is incredible! I had forgotten so many little items as I rushed to pack for my trip and she had everything stocked - from mouth wash to body lotion and snacks. She was understanding of my last-min work meeting request and allowed us to check out 1 hour later than planned so I could take my meeting without interrupting my workday (which helped me be less stressed, and made my boss happy too). The home is clean and pristine with so much to offer. You can tell Courtney puts her heart into her home and customer service <3 I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The 611 Suite is one of three rental units in an older home. The 611 Suite has been completely renovated and the floor plan adjusted to be suitable for rental. EVERYTHING...kitchen, laundry, bedroom, living room...is exceptionally well done for its purpose. Moreover, the hosts have been extremely thoughtful in how they stocked the unit with small appliances, utensils, dishes, silverware and so on. A person would be hard pressed to need something that was not available. Further, the hosts provide everyday items like pens, tape, post-it notes as well as some treats...candy, energy bars, nuts, etc. Combined, all the small touches make a guest feel welcome and comfortable right from the start.
It is an easy walk from the 611 Suite to downtown Coeur d'Alene and its restaurants, gift and specialty shops, parks and the entire Garden District. DO NOT miss Cisco's Gallery of rare and exceptional Native American, Cowboy and Western art, jewelry, weapons, furniture and more.

review_text: This is a beautiful little spot just a few blocks from downtown CDA. My wife and I walked downtown every day and spent time at the lakefront park areas. There are also hiking trails connected to the parks. We had a great time. We didn't need to contact Courtney during our stay, but upon checking in, she messaged me to let us know that she's there if we need anything. The kitchen was stocked with some quality staple items such as grass-fed butter, local raw honey, a few local coffees, a large selection of spices for cooking / seasoning which was great for cooking meals. The gas oven and cooktop are super nice, as was the cookware which we used for meals while there. The house and floors were very clean; we were comfortable walking around barefooted inside. The bathroom was immaculate, the shower is very luxurious, my wife felt like a queen using it. Just a fantastic place to stay, and we hope to go back some day.

review_text:
I donâ€™t normally write a really detailed review but this place deserves it! If I could give 10 stars I would. Courtney offered great communication and made sure we had everything we needed. There was one minor issue and she took care of it right away.
The home has everything you need. The kitchen is well appointed and has all the things you need for cooking like spices and cooking oil. Things that are kind of a pain to buy so it was nice not to have to. There were many ways to make coffee and a bag of coffee for us to use. She also left snacks and the yummiest huckleberry taffy from a local store. Fresh flowers awaited our arrival.
I really appreciated the hand soap, cleaning supplies, plenty of towels, tp etcâ€¦.
The bed was super comfy and the sheets so soft.
The bathroom is beautiful and the shower water pressure was amazing!
The front yard was the perfect spot for morning coffee or evening wine.
Can we talk location? A quick 5 minute walk takes you to all the best downtown has to offer. Check out the Bakery on the Lake. So yummy and just 2 blocks away! Gelato on the lake, also so good.
The care and attention to detail is evident when you stay here.
We didnâ€™t want to leave and cannot wait to return.

The decor was very clean and warm, and furniture was all super comfortable. While the home is an apartment, it felt very private and we had no issues with noise. We really enjoyed just sitting on the front porch.
Location was on point as well. Plenty of bars, restaurants and water attractions were within a 10 or 15 minute walk away but the home itself is away from the main strip hustle and bustle.
Check in and check out was easy, and Courtney was very available and accommodating with the few hiccups that came up.
This place 100% met or exceeded my expectations! I will recommend to friends and family and stay here again if given the opportunity.

review_text:
So there we were, at 1 AM, with no key to the AirBnB. We had lost it at a show in Spokane. No choice but to call our host, expecting grump and irritation (I would be if someone was calling that late). But no. She picked up the phone and was gracious, good-humored, and kinder than we deserved. She readily helped us out and gave us some tips to calm down, since we were a bit frazzled.
Mill House is the best vacation rental experience Iâ€™ve ever had, including fancy hotels. The charming decor, incredible attention to detail in amenities, and our hostâ€™s clear love for what she does shines through at every turn. From the fully stocked snack/tea/coffee bar, to the replacements for items frequently left behind, we felt so incredibly at home that we were sad to leave.
If you want a cozy, comfortable cabin-like experience in CDA, and want to feel like your host cares about you and your individual experience, Mill House is the best there is, and I hope to return there again someday.

review_text:
Great Little Spot Near Downtown
This property is an excellent value for the area, and I would highly recommend it. As can be seen from the pictures, it is somewhat small, but that is exactly what I consider to be the property's greatest strength. Designed with efficiency in mind, the space is exactly what a party of 2 would need to feel right at home - including several small but very personal touches (notepads and pencils, water bottles in fridge, etc). With right-down-the-street access to some of Couer D'Alene's finest shopping, eating, and scenery, what you get for the price is very difficult to beat in my opinion. 5 stars for the clear effort that the host puts into a quality experience. Make good memories here!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
First off, I'm not one who writes reviews. However, I feel that this stay deserves one. My daughter and I came to Post Falls to visit family and after a couple recent stays in hotels I had no desire to revisit that hell. I looked to Air BnB hoping for a better experience. Denise's place looked great online...as do they all. When we arrived we were very please to find exactly what was advertised plus more. The suite is private, comfortable, quiet and feels like home. You can even park in the garage if you want. So close to town and yet you are actually out in the country. Take your time when driving out to Denise's as you will absolutely see a ton of wildlife along the way. Deer, turkeys and more.
As to the suite, clean is an understatement. The suite is immaculate with a wonderful kitchenette, huge bathroom and I truly felt like I could just live there. Denise went out of her way to be available if you had any needs and yet was invisible.
Bottom line, 9.9 out of 10!

review_text: Cannot say enough about how amazing our stay was, the space was more than what we expected, everything was spotless and so cozy! The whole property is just beautiful, we encountered one of the hosts on a couple of occasions on the property over the course of our stay and she was just lovely, wanted to make sure we were comfortable and had all of our needs met and was genuinely concerned about the quality of our stay. The BEST part of our stay was the amazing Mina, who is a gorgeous, incredibly friendly and extremely well-trained German Shepard who greeted us with open paws and kept a caring eye on us and the rest of the property, when she and my husband weren't playing keep away with her ball, of course. I was feeling a little under the weather on one day during our stay so I stayed behind at the property and just rested in the very comfortable and homey setting, all the while with Mina making her rounds and always making a stop back by the apartment to make sure I was okay ( I purposely left the door open by a millimeter so I could see when she stopped by, but she is so well-trained, even when I thought I could use a furry snuggle, she would not enter the guest space, much to my disappointment, but very much to the credit of her caring and doting owner, as not all guests are fans of the furballs). In addition to the wonderful accommodations, the location itself was perfect, very short drive into quaint Post Falls, which has quite a bit to offer in the way of awesome restaurants, bars, shopping, etc., and even while it was snowing on our drive to the airport to return home, it was still less than a 45 minute drive. You don't need to look any further, do yourself a favor and book this fantastic space, you absolutely won't regret it!!!! Thank you so much to Denise and her husband (and Mina!) for a perfect long weekend!!!!!!!

Her home is close in to the city (10-12 minutes' drive), but far enough removed for some lovely peace and quiet. The suite is perfect for both a short overnight during a road trip or for a longer stay. The bed was SO comfortable - much appreciated after a busy week and a long drive from Whitefish, MT. She has everything you'd need to make some simple meals in the kitchenette space. Denise even provided ground coffee and some breakfast items for us. We would absolutely choose to stay at Denise's Airbnb again!

review_text: The Tubbs Hill Hideaway is a great efficiency apartment in a superb location. The studio apartment is located in a very nice residential neighborhood and is easily walkable to downtown Coeur dâ€™Alene (CdA), the Lake, and Tubbs Hill. Vanessa and Eric have thought of everything to make a stay enjoyable. A great layout, modern, and clean! The bed and couch were super comfortable and the bathroom so spacious. We didnâ€™t use the stove as we prefer to eat out while on vacation, but the coffee maker and microwave came in handy for us. There were a number of restaurant recommendations on the white board that we tried and agree the suggestions were worth mentioning. We sure appreciated the washer and dryer (and laundry soap) as we had come from another short term rental unit prior to coming to CdA. Communication before and during our stay with Vanessa was excellent and we enjoyed talking with Eric in person as well. We highly recommend the Tubbs Hill Hideaway for anyone wanting a comfortable and safe place as a â€œhome baseâ€ to explore CdA and nearby towns!

review_text: The Tubbs Hill Hideaway is a sweet little gem of a cottage. Merely one block from McEuen Park the proximity to downtown CDA is a treasure. This studio has everything you could need for an extended & comfortable stay, including a full-sized refrigerator, stacked washer/dryer and a well-stocked kitchenette. I spent an entire wintertime as the guest of Eric & Vanessa and they are exceptional hosts - taking extra care to notify me if winter storms were coming, checking up on me which I really appreciated. A daily 6am walk with the pup in tow to Vault Coffee - took mere minutes from this locale. This quaint part of town, called Tubbs Hills was filled with peaceful evenings, cute little cottages and very friendly neighbors. Lastly, donâ€™t miss the incredible â€˜gangâ€™ of wild turkeys which roost in the tops of pines in the park one block West and make a daily strut past the hideaway. If youâ€™re lucky enough to see the full show of plumage, be sure to capture it â€“ theyâ€™re certainly not camera shy â€“ and that can all be done while sitting comfortably warm and cozy on the Tubbs Hill Hideaway cottage sofa!

The location is incredible. Lots of cool stores and restaurants on site. McDonaldâ€™s is right there too, so my wife was able to get her tea every day. We visited Cold Stone Creamery a few nights as well.
They moved the weekly farmers market to this spot too, which was one of the main reasons we selected it. So nice to be able to walk right upstairs when youâ€™re done shopping!
The residents that we ran into were very friendly. They even asked about our travels. Total contrast to a lot of places the donâ€™t like short-term rentals in their building.
We ran into one small issue with the building door code, but it was mainly user error. On the building door, you have to enter # before you enter the passcode, whereas we didnâ€™t need to enter # before the garage or apartment passcode. They had # on the instructions, but i still had to think about it each time I entered it. Again, just user error.

review_text: A lovely spot to stay! To me, it has a cottage feel. So peaceful. Walking distance to the lake and trailhead. I enjoyed a hike around the water's edge and ended up in town for lunch. Magical. Lots of wildflowers to enjoy and photograph. There are two easy to ride bikes to use. I rode on the Centennial Trail for a few hours and rode right along the lake & river. I think serious bike riders can go much farther than I did. The stained-glass windows are pictured in the AirBnB listing, but these are truly wonderful. The carpet isn't absolutely perfect, and there are some chips on the corners here or there, this wasn't my focus. The kitchen was easy to cook in, and enjoyed playing a few games from the shelves in the living room. The interior colors and comfy furniture make this place a hidden gem.

Stayed over a week
review_text: Ramon's cabin is truly meant for a couples stay. We loved the wood floors and the granite countertops. The bed was super comfy and we slept well. The appliances worked well. Coffee and paper products were provided as well as personal hygiene items, such as shampoo, conditioner and body wash. The cabin has a great washer and dryer so we didn't have to pack too many clothes. Detergent and dryer products were available as well. The neighborhood is very quiet with some gorgeous Antebellum homes in the area. The cabin is about one block from the lake, which is surrounded by mountains and forests. The cabin is close to downtown, to grocery stores and other shopping venues as well. It's very easy to navigate Coeur d'Alene. Everyone is super friendly.

name: Monica
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
September 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Cottage was a welcoming retreat just a short walk from anything you might want to do in CDA. Ramon was quick to answer messages asking for recommendations before our stay for paddle board rental. Sanders Beach is close with free, on-street parking and it as busy as the downtown beach, Tubbs Hill is a block away for incredible sunset and rise views or gorgeous views of the lake any time. Bikes to cruise around this friendly neighborhood were a great touch. We also had turkeys with babies come through the front yard one morning.
The cottage it beautiful and cozy. The stained glass windows throughout made it feel like we were in an art gallery and the colors and swirls change with the light and shadows making us follow them throughout the day. The wood floors were beautiful as well. A unique and fantastic home.
The Viking, gas cook stove was a joy to use. The kitchen was well stocked and even had a coffee grinder and french press.
Lots of outside seating and opportunities to relax and connect here. The neighbors are great and have a little free library for kids so bring books to trade if you like that sort of thing. :)
We would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
This stay was wonderful! Private, clean, cozy, and everything about the bedding and nights' sleep was perfect.
If you are comfortable with being stuck in bed all day or plan to go out a lot and primarily stay here just to sleep, you'll love it. Before booking with them, consider that this location has two uncomfortable bar stools in addition to the bed, so seating options are limited.
The outdoor temps were in the negatives when we stayed, and the heaters were great! Easy to adjust too.
The hot tub was great! I am pregnant and wanted to enjoy it without overheating. It was easy to do, considering we could easily adjust the temp down a little.
Lastly, because of the cold, our car wouldn't start the morning we checked out. Our message to the host was received and responded to quickly, and Sam helped us jump the car and head out safely!

An 8 min drive to Hayden provided a get away for yummy food and grocery needs. The Fish Market place is awesome. There is also a road behind the cabin that makes for a great uphill walk. Our marriage was strengthened because of our stay. Thank you!

review_text: Wow. What a gorgeous, pristine, and extremely peaceful spot in Northern Idaho. My wife and I spent our honeymoon here and it was absolutely stunning. It's close enough to town while also feeling completely removed. While the tenants house is fairly close to the cabin, it felt very private and we were never bothered by anyone. Sam put a lot of heart and soul into this spot. It clearly shows and we were very honored to have it for our time in Hayden. Unfortunately, the downside of putting this honest review is that people will read it and I'm afraid of it being overbooked. We would love to come back here to get away from all the static from the world that constantly drowns us. It really helped us stay sane. Keep up the phenomenal work! I hope we were respectful to such a wonderful place!

Stayed one night
review_text: The cabin is very clean and cute. Very private. Beautiful lake near by. It is northern Idaho in the winter so I fully expected snow - however the pipes froze which meant no running water, no shower, no flushing toilet. The host did offer a camp shower water in a bag type of solution or to drive 15 minutes to the local gym to shower. I had traveled 30+ hours due to flight delays and was honestly just looking forward to a shower and some sleep. Arriving at the cabinâ€¦the driveway wasnâ€™t at all plowed outâ€¦I was told to â€œback up and get a running startâ€ to plow through the snow for parking. The path to the cabin wasnâ€™t at all shoveledâ€¦.which meant trudging through about 6+ inches of snow to the cabin. When walking from the cabin back to my car I actually fell - banged up my knee and foot pretty good and cut up my wrist/arms from the ice and snow. With that saidâ€¦I was able to take a nap and the bed was very comfortable. It was very quiet and peaceful.

Our only complaint, it snowed while on our North Pole cruise, so when we got back to the AirBnB around 8:30pm there was an extra few inches of snow, and even our 4 wheel drive Tahoe got stuck in the parking spot(its on a hill and we kept sliding back out into the road) and we had to drive up the road, turn around and try again 5 times before successfully parking. There is nowhere else to park so definitely thankful we decided to drive our truck and not our little car for this trip. So make sure you have the means of getting through lots of snow to stay here in the winter. Other than this little thing, we had the best stay. Comfortable bed, hot tub was amazing, super quiet and peaceful cabin, extremely clean. We will definitely come back!
